postcardText.front:
Boston, Mass., Shaw Memorial, Boston Common.
'Original Copyright, 1897 by Augustus Saint Gaudens'
This card authorized by the Sculptor.

message:
2/7/1908
Saw your name in Good Stories and would like to exchange with you. Trust you will [?and] as I find so many [?hr] [?r] not.
Col. Shaw to whom this monument was dedicated was killed in the [A?il] [??] July 18, 1863 during an assault on Fort Wagner. [??] a much [in?uring] piece of sculpture.
Miss Elizabeth B. Gahm
100 Antrim St. Cambridge, Mass.

postcardText.front: Fort Leavenworth - Thomas Ave., West End.

message:
My Dear Klea [?rien]
Aren’t you coming up Thanksgiving? Let me know and what train
Love to all Leila

postcardText.front: Primary and Grammar Schools, Montclair, N.J.

message:
Having a great time, such trotting around
Will write later
Mable

postcardText.front: CANADIAN ROCKIES, Mount Stephen & Cathedral Peak
postcardText.back: 55. CANADIAN ROCKIES, MOUNT STEPHEN AND CATHEDRAL PEAK. - One of the most interesting sights in the Canadian Rockies is Mount Stephen and Cathedral Peak, from which a splendid view can be had from Burgess Pass. Cathedral Peak is 10,204 feet high.

message:
Fertile Minn
July 28.17
Dear sister, Received your letter.
I can’t say just what day we’ll go to town, as [A?nt] is busy haying but will let you know as soon as we get a chance to get him. It is best to phone the same day that we go to town. So he can take train that day.
We are all well [??]

90 [?eusle?] Mass
114 East Main St
Torrington [??]
Hello folks! Up here [??] week & business is awful. Hope to go to Hartford next week. Will try & get over Sat. night. Haven’t seen a paper since I left. We are five miles from town and can’t get in at night -
Love to you both - [Wynni?]

postcardText.front: Water Purification Plant, Lake Park, Milwaukee, Wis.
postcardText.back: Erected at a cost of $5,000,000; covers 24 acres of land reclaimed from Lake Michigan. Chemical Building is the tallest unit, six stories in height. In its huge beds, water is filtered and treated to make it absolutely safe for drinking.

message:
My dear Mrs. Robert A. [Cromie?]-
X marks my room - lovely view & water running all the time. Expect to be much [??] on return. And a royal flush to you too,
Rattle

postcardText.front: Hilton Beach, St. Joe’s Isle, Ont., Canada

message:
Hi folks
We are having grand weather just like summer. Will be seeing you one of these days
Mildred

postcardText.front: A mule-drawn float in one of Mobile’s recent Mardi Gras night parades, Mobile, Alabama - 38 Mardi Gras - The legend of the Mardi Gras that originated in Europe is a later outgrowth here on Mobile’s first mystic society which is known as the famous old “Cowbellian de Rakins.” This organization held its first celebration on New Year’s Eve in 1831. On that eventful eve young men carried cowbells and rakes noisely through the city streets; and thus was born its name. Some of the original Cowbellians succeeded in 1842 to visit New Orleans en masse to present the first Mardi Gras ball of that city.

message:
Mobile Ala
March 28
Dear Michael We are staying beside a beautiful [??] - It is wonderful swimming = [??] & clear fast flowing water. The tides make a difference of from [??] to [the? ??] depth [?? ??] Bay - we shall be home Sunday Love to all
Holly

postcardText.front:
Sousa’s Memorial Fountain of Rainbows
Willow Grove Park
Willow Grove PA.

message:
Dear Eva;
Having a wonderful time. I’m beginning to think other towns are better than Cin.
Love
Florence & Mrs. Snow

Hello.
Going over letters I see I have no answer to my letter of Jan 26th. I would like to hear from you in regards as to whether your still collecting or not. Am starting to drop all who are not actual members. So hope to hear from you soon.
Sincerely
Wm. W Beal
55 Franklin St
Lawrence 3 Mass

postcardText.front: Shell Band Stand on the Esplanade along Charles River, Boston, Mass.

message:
Cheri Madame
Un mot [J?] [?oi?] [dire?] que je fais un [??] voyage et c’est [heir?] agréable d’être en vacances je [serai?] au Cape Cod la semaine prochaine je me propose de [prendre?] [?es] portrait je [?ou] [senai?] [hentot?] Luciele

Hi Everyone!
Halifax tonight. Conducted tour of the city tomorrow and toward gravel Pre & Evangeline Country tomorrow. Roads have been excellent. Enjoyed seeing tides push St. Julius’ [Rines?] backwards yesterday - Edie B.

postcardText.back:
Safari Hotel
Scottsdale, Arizona
First in Scottsdale, open all year, all 200 rooms overlook 11 acres of gardens, 2 swimming pools and children’s pool. Convention facilities for up to 500. Gracious dining in dining room or 24-hour Coffee House. Cocktails in Safari Lounge or lively French Quarter. Dancing nightly. Complete hotel services.
Owners, Ernie Uhlmann, Bill Ritter

message:
Hi. Hope you had a nice trip home. Sorry we missed you in Phoenix. We were in LA. Saw Betty [Borin?] in LA. See you when we get home
Love & Regards
Jane Weisman

postcardText.front: W-C-5 - Philips Memorial, State Teachers’ College, West Chester, Pa.
postcardText.back: West Chester is the county seat of Chester County. It is located 24 miles west of Philadelphia near historic Valley Forge. It is the seat of the State Teacher’s College.

message:
Hi John,
Christmas day temperature was 50. Went to Washington, D.C. Went to Phile. Went to Baltimore. Saw Valley Force. Saw United States Capitol. I am staying at my uncles in West Chester, Pa. I am leaving here Wed, Dec. 28 on a train. Going to New York now.
From Greg

postcardText.back:
'CAPT. ANDERSON'
This beautiful, triple deck 95 ft., 400-passenger air-conditioned and heated 'Capt. Anderson' features daily Sight-Seeing and Dinner-Dance Cruises. Private charters available. It operates from St. Petersburg Beach in the winter and the Capt. Anderson Marina, Panama City in the summer.
Phone: St. Petersburg (813) 367-7804
Phone Panama City (904) 234-5940
(800) 533-2288

message:
Dear Rosemary & Ivan
We are on the top deck of this cruise boat, enjoying the lovely scenery, the relaxing hum of the motor. It’s a 2-hr trip, so am writing a few cards. Wonderful [?athe?] so far - been to the beach twice, Disney World all day yesterday, will go again Fri. Laura is so much fun. She’s staying til Sun.
Love, Liz

Nov 24
Dear Cullie:
Just found this card addressed to you and never sent I was awful sick yesterday had the flu so don’t feel very good today but better

postcardText.back: OLD SIEGE WALL, Marion Square - Within an iron railing on the plaza is a remnant of the old “Tapia” or more commonly called “Tabby” work built during the Revolution as a defense for the American Army.

message:
Hello Snookums
Kind of cold here low work
don't know when I will be home
guess in the Spring So long
Dave
